overview: Zephaniah announces the coming 'day of the LORD' in terrifying terms, yet ends with beautiful promises of restoration. God will judge, then gather and rejoice over a humble remnant.

verses.text: The LORD your God is in your midst, a mighty one who will save; he will rejoice over you with gladness; he will quiet you by his love; he will exult over you with loud singing.
Seek the LORD, all you humble of the land, who do his just commands; seek righteousness; seek humility; perhaps you may be hidden on the day of the anger of the LORD.

passages.title: God Rejoices Over His People
passages.summary: After stern warnings of judgment, the book ends with God singing joyfully over His restored people—a stunning picture of divine love.

facts.text: Zephaniah 3:17 is the only verse describing God singing—and He sings over His people with joy.
Zephaniah was a great-great-grandson of King Hezekiah, making him royalty as well as a prophet.
The 'day of the LORD' inspired the medieval hymn 'Dies Irae' (Day of Wrath), used in classical requiem masses.

figures.name: Zephaniah
figures.description: A royal prophet who proclaimed both terrifying judgment and tender restoration, ending with God's song of love.

videos.title: Zephaniah Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores the day of the LORD and God's joyful restoration.
